Adult.description: Red-breasted Sapsuckers have extensive red covering the head and continuing down onto the breast, while Red-naped has black and white patterning on the face.

Male.description: Yellow-bellied Sapsuckers lack the red nape, have a black border around the red throat, and occur primarily in eastern North America, overlapping with Red-naped Sapsuckers only in southwest Alberta.

Female.description: Female Williamson's Sapsuckers lack the vertical wing patch that is present on female Red-naped Sapsuckers and have an unmarked tan head.

Male.description: Male Williamson's Sapsuckers have solid black backs unlike Red-naped Sapsuckers. Red is limited to the throat in Williamson's while Red-naped Sapsuckers have a red crown, nape, and throat.
